DataElement.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Authorization Response Reuse Template Observation Outcome Data Negation Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A reusable, "template" description of an allowable response to a stratification criterion. EXAMPLE(S): The stratification criterion for gender can have permissible answers of male and female Specifies whether, when the observation event occurred, the finding communicated by the value attribute was NOT found. NOTE(S): This attribute should only be used when the terminology used for the defined observation result value is not itself capable of expressing negated findings (e.g., ICD9).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Authorization Response Reuse Template Observation Outcome Data Negation Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.:A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question, request, criticism, or accusation.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Stratification Criterion Authorization Response Reuse Template Observation Outcome
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.:A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question, request, criticism, or accusation.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

Decision of the competent authorities in form of a letter, document, or verbal or electronic form, that confirms that somebody has permission to do something or be somewhere, e.g. to realize a given project.
A statement (either spoken or written) that is made in reply to a question, request, criticism, or accusation.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.

Property.preferredDefinition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
